name: Kepler-538
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-538 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-538 is a star with 0.89 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.87 times its radius. It is located 510.95598959999995 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 5.3 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Kepler-538 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-538 system

Kepler-538 b

Kepler-538 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the Transit method. The mass of Kepler-538 b is 10.6 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-538 b is 2.215 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-538 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-538, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
